messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.
Here are some examples how the 'emulate_interaction' function should be used.
Please test my website: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description": "The start page of a web site with multiple calculators for different purposes. There are buttons to navigate to the differet calculators and a button to switch the language of the web site. The current language is English.", "new_testing_goal": "Test the calculator for calculating the area of a circle in multiple languages.", "explanation": "First navigate to the calculator for the area of a circle. Then input a radius and calculate the area. Switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "click", "element_id": "btn-area-circle"}}

messages.content: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The shopping cart overlay is now showing just one item, the Galaxy M30, after the removal of the Galaxy A2 Core. The options to adjust the quantity, remove the item, or proceed to checkout remain available. The navigation bar still includes links to Home, Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series. The cart shows a total cost reflecting only the Galaxy M30 price. The background likely indicates that the M Series category page is still visible behind the cart overlay.","new_testing_goal":"Evaluate the checkout process, including its interface and functionality, by proceeding to the checkout page to finalize a purchase.","explanation":"Click the 'Checkout' button in the shopping cart overlay to proceed to the checkout page. This action will allow us to evaluate the checkout page's interface, the required fields for completing a purchase, and how the website handles the checkout process.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r7:"}}

function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The checkout page is displayed with a form for customer and address details, payment selection, and a submit button. A cart item summary shows a Galaxy M30 with its price. The navigation bar includes links to Home, Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series categories.","new_testing_goal":"Complete the checkout process by filling in customer and address details, selecting a payment option, and submitting the form to evaluate the overall process and to test if the order is successfully placed.","explanation":"Begin by filling in the 'First Name' field in the customer information section. This step will start the process of completing the necessary information for the checkout, allowing us to observe how the website handles form completion and submission.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":r42:","keys":"Jane"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.

Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Continue filling out the checkout form by completing the Address section and choosing a payment method, then submit the form to assess the process's functionality and validation mechanisms..

Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Explore the product categories and product details to examine their loading and display functionalities. Test adding products to the cart and then check the cart's functionality.": 3, "Test the addition of multiple products from different categories to the cart and the removal of these items to evaluate cart functionality and update mechanisms.": 1, "Evaluate the cart's update mechanism by adding another product from a different category and testing the quantity adjustment feature.": 1, "Test the addition of a product from the M Series category to the cart and evaluate the cart's functionality for handling multiple products, including checking out.": 1, "Add the Galaxy M30 to the cart from the M Series category to evaluate the cart's functionality for handling multiple items and move to checkout.": 1, "Proceed to the checkout process to evaluate its functionality and interface.": 1, "Complete the checkout process by filling in customer and address details, selecting a payment option, and submitting the form to evaluate the overall process and to test if the order is successfully placed.": 2, "Complete the customer and address part of the checkout process, select a payment method, and submit the order. This will help evaluate the checkout process functionality and order submission on the website.": 1, "Complete the email and address input, select a payment method, and submit the checkout form to test the final steps of the purchasing process.": 2, "Complete the address part of the checkout process by filling out all remaining fields, choose a payment method, and submit the form to evaluate address input handling and payment method selection.": 1, "Test the functionality of the address fields and the payment method selection to ensure they correctly handle the user input and selection. This includes filling out the remaining address fields, selecting a payment method, and attempting to submit the order.": 1, "Test the payment method selection after completing the address details.": 1, "Finalize the checkout process by completing the address section, selecting a payment method, and submitting the order to evaluate the complete order processing flow, including validation of input fields and successful submission.": 1, "Complete the checkout process by filling in the zip code, selecting a payment method, and submitting the order.": 1, "Test the payment method selection functionality and the order submission process to ensure the checkout system works as intended.": 1, "Explore and test the navigation and product categories to ensure they load correctly and display the intended content. This includes clicking on various product category links from the main menu and verifying that the respective product listings are correctly displayed.": 2, "Test the functionality of adding products to the shopping cart from a different category and check the cart's update mechanism after adding. This will include navigating to another product category, adding a product to the cart, and checking the cart's item count and details.": 1, "Test adding a product from the S10 category to the shopping cart to evaluate the update mechanism of the cart, then proceed to explore and test another category.": 1, "Test the shopping cart\u2019s functionality further by adjusting the quantity of the added item, removing the item, and exploring the checkout process. This will assess the responsiveness and accuracy of the cart\u2019s update mechanism.": 1, "Further test the shopping cart by attempting to remove an item and then proceeding to checkout, analyzing the removal functionality and the checkout process.": 1, "Test the functionality of the 'clear cart' button to assess its effectiveness in removing all items from the shopping cart, then proceed to navigate to another product category and add a new item to the cart. This action aims to evaluate the shopping cart's functionality in handling item removals and updates.": 1, "Navigate to the A Series category and add a product to the shopping cart. This will help us test the functionality of the shopping cart after it has been previously cleared, ensuring it can update with new items added post-clearance.": 1, "Test adding a product from the A Series category to the shopping cart and then proceed to check the functionality of viewing and managing the cart's contents.": 1, "Test the shopping cart's functionality by adjusting the quantity of the product, removing the product, and checking the checkout process. Each step will help assess the responsive behavior of the cart in updating item count, total cost, and navigation to the checkout page.": 1, "Test the removal of the Galaxy A80 from the shopping cart to assess how the cart updates in terms of item count and total cost. Following this, test the checkout process by proceeding to the checkout page.": 1, "Test the checkout process with an empty cart to assess how the website handles attempting to proceed to checkout without any items in the cart. This step is critical for understanding the website's handling of edge cases regarding the checkout process.": 2, "Test the checkout submission functionality with an empty cart and an incomplete form to evaluate form validation and error handling mechanisms. This includes attempting to submit the checkout form without filling in any details to identify how the website responds to empty fields or incorrect inputs.": 1, "Explore the product categories, particularly focusing on the S10 and M Series, to identify the range of products offered and test the functionality of adding products to the shopping cart from these categories. This will help assess the website's catalog navigation and the responsiveness of the shopping cart interface.": 1, "Test adding different S10 models to the shopping cart to evaluate how the cart handles multiple items, their quantities, and pricing updates. Following this, proceed to test the M Series category for its range of products and adding a product to the cart.": 1, "Navigate to the M Series category to explore the range of products offered and add an item from this category to the shopping cart. This will help assess the website\u2019s responsiveness and functionality regarding cart updates when adding items from multiple categories.": 1, "Navigate to the M Series category to explore the range of products offered and add an item from this category to the shopping cart. This action aims to test the website's navigation functionality and the responsiveness of adding products from multiple categories to the shopping cart.": 1, "Add the Galaxy M30 to the shopping cart to evaluate its functionality for handling multiple items from different categories, and check the responsiveness of the cart's update mechanism. Follow this by attempting to add the same product again to test the website's handling of duplicate items. Finally, navigate to the cart to review the items and proceed to checkout.": 1, "Test the removal functionality of items in the shopping cart to assess how the website updates in terms of item count and total cost. Following this, navigate to the checkout process to evaluate its functionality.": 1, "Navigate to the checkout process to evaluate its interface and functionality.": 1, "Test the functionality of the payment method selection and the form submission to ensure the correct processing of checkout.": 2, "Complete the checkout process by filling out the remaining form fields, selecting a payment method, and submitting the form. This will test the form's validation, the payment selection functionality, and the website's capability to process an order.": 1, "Continue filling out the remaining checkout form fields, select a payment method, and submit the order to assess the validation process and the overall order completion functionality.": 1, "Finish the checkout process by filling out all address details, select a payment option, and finalize the order by submitting it. This will test the address input validation, payment selection functionality, and the checkout process completion.": 1, "Validate form functionality including address input fields, payment option selection, and successful submission response.": 1, "Proceed to fill in the city, state, and zip code fields, select a payment method, and attempt to submit the checkout form. This process will test the website's ability to handle form submission with complete information.": 1, "Finalize filling out the state and zip code in the form, select a valid payment method, and submit the order to ensure comprehensive testing of the checkout process including form validation and submission response.": 1, "Fill in the Zip Code for the address, select a payment method, and submit the order to fully test the checkout process including form submission and potential validation mechanisms.": 1, "Finalize the order submission after ensuring all required information is filled out correctly, including selecting a payment method. This will test the checkout process's end-to-end functionality, including form validation and submission.": 1, "Test the 'add to cart' functionality for a product within the Galaxy category and check the cart's responsive update to this action.": 1, "Test the cart's functionality by trying to remove the Galaxy A2 Core from the cart, and then proceed to checkout. This will assess the removal functionality and the checkout process, providing insights into how well the website manages cart updates and order processing.": 1, "Proceed to the checkout page to evaluate the checkout process and its interface, after ensuring the cart reflects the correct items and quantities.": 1, "Test the functionality and user experience of filling out the checkout form, including validation feedback for required fields, and the usability of payment method selection.": 1, "To assess the form's validation mechanism and proper handling of incomplete submissions, providing insights into user experience during checkout.": 1, "Fill out the Address section of the checkout form to test the form's completeness and validation feedback.": 1, "Complete filling out the Address section and select a payment method to test the checkout process. Then, submit the form to assess the handling of submissions and confirm the order placement functionality.": 1, "Finish filling out the Address section, select a suitable payment method, and submit the form to test order placement even with a $0.00 total, addressing a potential edge case.": 1, "Fill in the State and Zip Code fields, choose a payment method, and submit the order to test the form's handling of complete information and validation mechanisms.": 1, "Complete the checkout process by filling in the zip code, selecting a payment method, and submitting the order. This will test the website's handling of form submissions and validations.": 1, "Test the payment method selection functionality and then proceed to submit the order to evaluate how the system processes a submission with an empty cart. This will highlight if there are any issues or special handling for orders with $0.00 total.": 1, "Explore the navigation and various product categories to ensure they load correctly and display the intended content. This includes clicking on various product category links from the main menu and verifying that the respective product listings are correctly displayed.": 1, "Test the functionality of adding products from the Galaxy category to the cart, then explore another category, add a product from there, and finally review and clear the cart.": 1, "Test the cart's functionality for adjusting the quantity of products, removing products, and navigating to the checkout.": 1, "Test removing a product from the cart to evaluate the update mechanism for item count and total cost. Following this, test the checkout process to assess its functionality.": 1, "Evaluate the website's form validation and error handling mechanisms by attempting to submit the checkout form with incomplete information.": 1, "Test the functionality of filling out the checkout form, including the validation of input fields and the submission process with complete and correct information.": 1, "Complete filling out the customer information section of the checkout form.": 1, "Continue filling out the customer information section by entering the email address, complete the address section of the checkout form, select a payment method, and attempt to submit the form to assess the checkout process's completeness and validation mechanisms.": 1, "Fill in the address section of the checkout form with valid data and select a payment method to continue the assessment of the checkout process.": 1, "Complete the address section of the checkout form, select a payment method, and submit the form to fully test the checkout process including form validation and transaction functionality.": 1, "Finalize the address details in the checkout process, select a payment method, and attempt to submit the checkout form. This will help test the form's validation for the address section and the functionality of selecting a payment method and submitting the order.": 1, "Complete filling in the 'State' and 'Zip Code' for the address section, select a payment method, and submit the form to fully evaluate the checkout process.": 1, "Finalize the checkout process by entering the required Zip Code, selecting a payment method, and submitting the order to assess form validation, payment processing, and order confirmation functionalities.": 1, "Select a payment method and submit the checkout form to evaluate the payment selection functionality and to assess how the system processes a submission with a full cart.": 1, "Test the functionality of adding products from different categories to the shopping cart and the responsiveness of the cart interface. This involves adding a product from the Galaxy category, then navigating to another category, adding a product from there, and finally reviewing the cart contents.": 1, "Test the capability of adding items from another category (S10 series) to the shopping cart, and assess the cart's functionality in reflecting these changes accurately. Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.

Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :r3u:, :r0:-home, :r0:-galaxy, :r0:-s10, :r0:-m_series, :r0:-a_series, :r1:, :r2:, :r3v:, :r40:, :r41:. Only use the send_keys action with writable elements. The writable elements have the following ids: :r42:, :r43:, :r44:, :r45:, :r46:, :r47:, :r48:, :r49:. Only use the clear action with clearable elements. The clearable elements have the following ids: :r42:, :r43:, :r44:, :r45:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

keys.description: the keys to be sent to the input element

anyOf.description: sends keystrokes to an html element

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

anyOf.description: resets the contents of an html element
